title: Level 7 Space Practice Test
description: Test your skills with angle relationships, parallel lines, transformations on the Cartesian plane, and properties of quadrilaterals.

questions.question: Two angles are complementary. One angle is $34°$. What is the other?
questions.explanation: Complementary angles sum to $90°$. Other angle $= 90° - 34° = 56°$.

questions.question: Two straight lines cross. One angle is $115°$. What is the vertically opposite angle?
questions.explanation: Vertically opposite angles are always equal. So the vertically opposite angle is also $115°$.

questions.question: Parallel lines are cut by a transversal. A co-interior angle is $62°$. What is the other co-interior angle?
questions.explanation: Co-interior angles (same-side interior angles) are supplementary when lines are parallel. $180° - 62° = 118°$.

questions.question: What are the coordinates of the point $(3, -5)$ after reflection in the $y$-axis?
questions.explanation: Reflection in the $y$-axis changes the sign of $x$: $(x, y) \to (-x, y)$. So $(3, -5) \to (-3, -5)$.

questions.question: Which quadrilateral has all sides equal but angles that are NOT all $90°$?
questions.explanation: A rhombus has all four sides equal, but its angles are not necessarily $90°$ (opposite angles are equal). A square has all sides equal AND all angles $90°$.

questions.question: What are the coordinates of $(-2, 4)$ after a $180°$ rotation about the origin?
questions.explanation: $180°$ rotation about the origin: $(x, y) \to (-x, -y)$. So $(-2, 4) \to (2, -4)$.

questions.question: Two supplementary angles are in the ratio $2 : 7$. What is the larger angle?
questions.explanation: Supplementary angles sum to $180°$. Total parts: $2 + 7 = 9$. One part: $180 \div 9 = 20°$. Larger angle: $7 \times 20 = 140°$.

questions.question: What is the sum of the interior angles of any quadrilateral?
questions.explanation: The interior angles of any quadrilateral always sum to $360°$. This is because a quadrilateral can be split into two triangles, and $2 \times 180° = 360°$.

questions.question: The point $A(5, 2)$ is translated $3$ units left and $4$ units down. What are the new coordinates? Write as (x,y).
questions.explanation: $3$ units left: $x = 5 - 3 = 2$. $4$ units down: $y = 2 - 4 = -2$. New point: $(2, -2)$.

questions.question: Parallel lines are cut by a transversal. An alternate angle is $73°$. What is the corresponding angle at the same intersection as the alternate angle?
questions.explanation: Alternate angles are equal when lines are parallel, so the alternate angle is $73°$. The corresponding angle at the same intersection position on the other parallel line is also $73°$, since corresponding angles are equal.
